--- title: "Text" date: "2023-11-13" date_end: "2023-11-17" --- ## Readings - {{< fa book >}} Rohan Alexander, ["Text as data," chapter 16 in *Telling Stories with Data*](https://tellingstorieswithdata.com/16-text.html) - {{< fa book >}} Look through some of the chapters in [*Tidy Text Mining*](https://www.tidytextmining.com/) [@SilgeRobinson:2017] (but *definitely* don't read them all! You just need to get a taste of what modern text analysis looks like.) - A bunch of (really) short things: - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} Evangeline Reynolds, ["Federalist Papers"](https://evangelinereynolds.netlify.app/post/federalist-papers/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} Julia Silge, ["She Giggles, He Gallops"](https://pudding.cool/2017/08/screen-direction/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} Abby Ohlheiser, ["These are the words most associated with men and women, according to Facebook status updates"](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-intersect/wp/2016/05/28/these-are-the-words-most-associated-with-men-and-women-according-to-facebook-status-updates/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [Six Ideas for Displaying Qualitative Data](http://annkemery.com/qual-dataviz/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [Word clouds considered harmful](http://www.niemanlab.org/2011/10/word-clouds-considered-harmful/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [Word clouds cause death… or something](https://flowingdata.com/2011/10/18/word-clouds-cause-death-or-something/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [When It's Ok to Use Word Clouds](https://www.vis4.net/blog/2015/01/when-its-ok-to-use-word-clouds/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [The Class of 2011](http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/06/10/education/commencement-speeches-graphic.html) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [Every time Ford and Kavanaugh dodged a question, in one chart](https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2018/9/28/17914308/kavanaugh-ford-question-dodge-hearing-chart) - {{< fa brands twitter >}} [Tweet by \@s_soroka](https://twitter.com/s_soroka/status/907941270735278085) ### Possible questions to reflect on ::: {.callout-warning} #### This is not a required list! Remember, you don't need to answer all of these—or even any of them! These are just here to help guide your thinking. **Write about whatever you want.** ::: - Why is qualitative data difficult to visualize? - Why are word clouds so problematic?
